reviews.review_msg: Material is deeply interesting and she allows for people to share their ideas and participate in class, but knows when to cut people off.  I think this is a really great skill for a phil prof to have.  Fair marker.  Might spend a little too long explaining some ideas, but that could also just be in virtue of the fact that this was a 200lvl class.

I learned next to nothing, and the prof was in his own little world when he gave lectures.  he had no assigned readings and it took him an entire year (12 months later) to submit my friend's final grade.  I am amazed that this man still has a job.  He was nice, but I want my money back.
He would be fine if he didn't mumble and he didn't trail off at the end of his sentences.

Intro to Existentialism is a blast with Ray Jennings. He offers us enough guidance to find our own way through this very rich and complex period of Philosophy, without getting lost. Though at times he can be obscure, I think that's "the point". He is never condescending and always respectful. I really love this class.

Intro to Existentialism. Unfortunately, he seems to lecture on everything but that. There is a list of books he will give as optional reading; read them, it will help your understanding of the course because his lectures will not. No guidance in assignments. Interesting subject, but the course wasn't very good. It at the very end though.
Great course.  I really enjoyed the lectures.
really good prof.. explained the material well and showed lots of enthusiasm (for nietszche)
